TopicTitle: RT-5 "Flea" makes a great cheap upper stage for light payloads

Articles.Content: if you decrease the thrust to a very low level, it lasts very long and is easy to control. with a rt-10 (with thrust limit of 50) lower stage and a rt-5 upper stage (with t limit of 11) i managed to get a small probe with a tiny amount of fuel and an "ant" engine to a 75km sub orbital trajectory with near 2000 m/s speed. two solid boosters cost less than 1000 funds.
It's a great kick stage for tiny probes too. You can send a half-ton probe to Duna with a Flea from an 80km orbit, just adjust with RCS or something on the way.
also i realized that when you use smaller decoupler between two srbs cause it's lighter, actually it creates way more drag than regular sized decoupler and limits the rocket.

21 minutes ago, rdem said:

also i realized that when you use smaller decoupler between two srbs cause it's lighter, actually it creates way more drag than regular sized decoupler and limits the rocket.

On that topic, I wish that a size one decoupler would produce a size one shroud around the Flea.  It looks kind of ridiculous when I have two size one fuel tanks connected by a size one decoupler with a shroud narrow around the Flea.

This is actually my plan for the Flea in a career save with custom PartUpgrades.

It starts off as this silly little low-efficiency proto-SRB with absurd TWR. But I'll give it a researchable part upgrade that ups its vac Isp and lowers its asl Isp, perhaps with a bit of thrust reduction. That way it will change roles completely - moving the part out of a niche in which it has been eclipsed, into a niche where it is unique. A true solid upper stage, just like several IRL rockets use 'em.

Edited October 18, 2016 by Streetwind

2 hours ago, regex said:

It's a great kick stage for tiny probes too. You can send a half-ton probe to Duna with a Flea from an 80km orbit, just adjust with RCS or something on the way.

I've done this at least once! Quite a few RL probes are sent on their way this way, New Horizons in particular comes to mind.
I still don't like using it merely because it looks stupid, and thus i continue to hope it gets redone to be a Size 0 booster.

1 minute ago, parameciumkid said:

I still don't like using it merely because it looks stupid

It makes a nice upper stage if you stick it beneath the payload inside a fairing. Other than that though, it doesn't look too great.
